Text:
Is this a 3D copy? It's in split screen in VLC...

If not what am I doing wrong?
VLC? People still use that junk?

If you wondered, what is the difference between this and AMiABLE's version, I made a couple of comparison screens:

The.Amazing.Spider-Man.2012.1080p.BluRay.X264-AMiABLE [PublicHD] (Size: 9.84 GiB)
http://i.imgur.com/ChEN7.jpg

The Amazing Spider-Man 2012 1080p Blu-ray Remux AVC DTS-HD MA 5.1 - KRaLiMaRKo (Size: 26.88 GiB)
http://i.imgur.com/uHupM.jpg

For me, there is no difference at all. So it's better to download the 10 GiB version.

I hate this huge black bars around the screen. It feels like you're watching the movie with your eyes almost shut. Surely not what I was expecting after a 10GB download. Besides that, it has a good quality.
@Goldfire1986 what the fuck do you use?

@t amante
That's called cinematic widescreen resolution. 2.4:1 aspect ratio. That's why the 1080p resolution is 1920x808 instead of 1920x1080. So, unless you get a 2.4:1 monitor, you better get used to it. Just about all decent HD movie rips are going to be like that, because it's how the movies are actually filmed. If you get something that fills your whole screen, it's because it's letterboxed on the sides, and you're not getting the whole picture.

OK what's the deal here? Is this BluRay disk mastered incorrectly? I downloaded another rip and the brightness is so low I tried to correct it, but the correction was so huge that it caused banding in broad flat tonal areas. I know 3D movies are notorious for being dim, but this 2D version is even dimmer than what I see in theaters. I mean, look at this one still:

http://i.imgur.com/kfqAH.jpg

Now here's what it SHOULD look like, I corrected it in Photoshop.

http://i.imgur.com/cZpvV.jpg

I checked the histogram, the brightest white in that still is at 160 out of 255, when it should be at 255, the max. This video is using only 62.5% of the available dynamic range of brightness from black to white. The brightest white is 37% grey. This is totally fucked up. Is this a problem in the rip? Or was the film deliberately mastered in a terribly low brightness? Maybe they deliberately lowered the brightness, to simulate the poor brightness of 3D projection systems? Something is wrong here.

JUST A HEADS UP FOR PEOPLE DOWNLOADING THIS TORRENT 

WARNING:  THE TOTAL RECALL MOVIE AND THE AMAZING SPIDER-MAN MOVIE ARE INFECTED WITH CINIVIA AND WILL NOT PLAY ON PS3 OR ANY BLURAY PLAYERS THAT HAVE CINIVIA IN THEIR FIRMWARE IF THE AUDIO IS CONVERTED TO AC3 OR AAC FORMAT FROM DTS. 

IF YOU HAVE TO CONVERT THE AUDIO FROM DTS TO AC3 AND VIDEO FROM MKV TO MP4 TO PLAY ON PS3 IT SUCKS BECAUSE THE PS3 WON'T PLAY IT. 

HOWEVER IF YOU HAVE A BLURAY PLAYER THAT IS CINIVIA FREE LIKE I DO THEN THIS MKV VIDEO WILL PLAY FINE.
